creditline: Gift of the Clark Center for Japanese Art & Culture; formerly given to the Center by Elizabeth and Willard Clark
description: one long line of delicate, looping calligraphy at upper center; stalk with delicate foliage growing from bottom edge LRC; cluster of little red berries growing from branch
inscription:
南天の雪ふみ落す小鳥か那 {Nanten no / yukifumi otosu / kotori kana} (Knocking the snow / off the nandina bushes— / little birds) [Stephen Addiss]

Poem: Haritsu kushū Winter no. 26
markings: red seal: 福田世耕 {Fukuda Seikō} [Fukuda Seikō #4]
title: Nandina Tree
